item.title: Polkadot{.js} Extension Guide
item.description: In this tutorial, we present how to use Polkadot{.js} Extension to create/import Khala account. Khala Network, as the parachain of Kusama, shares the accounts of Kusama Relay Chain. Install Polkadot{.js} Extension Get extension from https://polkadot.js.org/extension/ Choose Chrome or Firefox Extension according to your explorer Create New Account Choose your installed Polkadot{.js} Extension; Click “+”, and choose “Create new account”; Keep mnemonic seed safe; Choose Network “Allow use on any chain”, fill in the descriptive name and password, and click “Add the account with the generated seed”.

item.title: Guidance of Delegation StakePool
item.description: Delegator Token holders (i.e. delegators) can obtain mining rewards by delegating PHA to the StakePool, which can be understood as “depositing to earn interest”. This guide will introduce how to earn rewards through delegation in Phala Network. How to Delegate Introduction of Delegation Phala Networkâ€™s protocol allows token holders to delegate PHA into StakePool. The owner of the StakePool uses the PHA to mine and stake. The mining rewards will be distributed to the delegators according to the delegation share.

item.title: Set Up Identity
item.description: Phala Network provides a naming system that allows participants to add personal information to their on-chain account and subsequently ask for verification of this information by registrars. After your identity is added, it can be used in many applications in Phala or Khala ecosystem. For example, in Secure Worker mining, this will help you attracting delegators to trust and vote for you. Setting an Identity Users can set an identity by registering through default fields such as legal name, display name, website, Twitter handle, Riot handle, etc.
